title: Windsor Officer & K9 in need, colleagues seek help | Renee | The River 105.9
text:
Windsor Officer & K9 in need, colleagues seek help posted by Renee - share 
Officer Steve Vesco's K9, Iko, has a herniated disc that has almost paralyzed him. 
HELP K9 Iko read the story and share! Story & Photo courtesy of WFSB Channel 3 our news partner. 
By Rob Polansky 
Police have launched a fundraising website to help cover mounting medical bills for a soon-to-be retired K9. 
Officer Steve Vesco's K9, Iko, has a herniated disc that has almost paralyzed him. 
The pair are with the Windsor Police Department. 
The Connecticut Police Work Dog Association said that the dog has undergone several treatments and surgery to fix the disc. 
However, the expenses have gotten to be too much. 
Vesco said he's been scrambling to find a way to pay for his partner's expenses. 
His colleagues at the CPWDA set up a GoFundMe account to help with the efforts. 
The page has been shared hundreds of times and has raised more than $3,300 in 21 hours. 
For information on donating, click here . HI! I have lived and worked in CT my whole life....I LOVE it here! I grew up listening to WHCN..and it's so cool to be a part of the team now!I knew in 8th grade at O'Brien School in East Hartford that I wanted to be a DJ! I also host 2 shows: Celebrity Access, where you'll get great interviews from all the stars & Community Access, a show that provides all kinds of lifestyle information, health tips, family events, public service announcements on and on, if it's going on in Connecitut we're on it!
